Class Maze

maze.Maze

java.io.Serializable
public class Maze
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
Class to construct and represent the maze

    Nested Classes

    class  Maze.Coordinate
    Subclass to represent any coordinate in the maze
    static class  Maze.Direction
    Enum to represent the 4 different directions that a the route can travel

      Gets the entrance tile for the maze
      Returns:

    • getExit

      Gets the exit tile for the maze

    • getTiles

      public java.util.List<java.util.List<Tile>> getTiles()
      Gets the list of all tiles contained in the maze.
      Returns:
      a 2d list of tiles which are contained in the maze

    • getAdjacentTile

      public Tile getAdjacentTile​(Tile originTile, Maze.Direction dir)
      Gets the tile in the given direction relative to the given tiles position
      Parameters:
      originTile - The base tile used for return tiles postion
      dir - The enum direction for the offset from the origin tile
      Returns:
      Returns the tile adjacent to the origin tile in a given direction if its an invalid coord (out of bounds) it will return null.

    • getTileLocation

      public Maze.Coordinate getTileLocation​(Tile targetTile)
      Gets the coordinates of a passed tile
      Parameters:
      targetTile - The tile that you want to find the coords for.
      Returns:
      Returns a Coordinate initialised to the tiles x and y. Returns null if tile not in maze.

    • getTileAtLocation

      public Tile getTileAtLocation​(Maze.Coordinate targetCoord)
      Gets the tile at a given Coordinates location
      Parameters:
      targetCoord - The target coord with x and y initialised for the location
      Returns:
      Returns a tile a at the location of a given Coordinate

    • fromTxt

      public static Maze fromTxt​(java.lang.String file) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Creates a maze by reading in a txt file and converting the charecters to a 2d list of tiles.
      Parameters:
      file - A string containing the full path of the file to be converted.
      Returns:
      Returns a maze object containing a list of tiles representing the maze, a set entrance and a set exit.
      Throws:
      InvalidMazeException - When there is an invalid character in maze.
      MultipleEntranceException - When there are multiple entances.
      MultipleExitException - When there are multiple exits.
      RaggedMazeException - When row or column lenght are uneven.
      NoExitException - When no exit is found.
      NoEntranceException - When no entrance is found.
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - When the file string is invalid.

    • fromRecursiveDevision

      public static Maze fromRecursiveDevision​(int widthMaze, int heightMaze)
      Custom maze builder which uses recursive division to construct a random maze.
      Parameters:
      widthMaze - The width of the required maze
      heightMaze - The height of the required maze
      Returns:
      Returns the constructed maze.

    • divide

      public static Maze divide​(Maze mazeToSplit, int x, int y, int width, int height)
      Recursive fucntion which divides the maze into two parts places a wall down the centre and then calls itself on the to parts it creates until there is a gap of 2 inbetween (1 creates adjacent walls)
      Parameters:
      mazeToSplit - The maze that needs to be broken down
      x - The leftmost x value of the section of maze to be split
      y - The uppermost y value of the section of maze to be split
      width - The width of the section to be split
      height - The height of the section to be split
      Returns:
      Returns the maze split maze.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Overrides the default toString method to output the maze with numbered axis
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      Returns the maze as a string
